title: Sets with no solutions to some symmetric linear equations
abstract:
We expand the class of linear symmetric equations for which large sets with
no non-trivial solutions are known. Our idea is based on first finding a small
set with no solutions and then enlarging it to arbitrary size using a
multi-dimensional construction, crucially assuming the equation in primitive.
We start by presenting the technique on some new equations. Then we use it to
show that a symmetric equation with randomly chosen coefficients has a
near-optimal set with no non-trivial solutions. We also show a construction for
a wide class of symmetric equation in 6 variables. In the final section we
present a couple of remarks on non-symmetric equations.
